abstracts.cdata!:
The Emergency Recovery Grant Project of
            Malawi had the following ratings: outcomes were highly
            satisfactory, risk to development outcome was low or
            negligible, Bank performance was highly satisfactory, and
            borrower performance was highly satisfactory. The lessons
            learned included: 1) The Bank should consider whether direct
            disbursement, as is now carried out for development policy
            assistance, can be permitted for emergency assistance in
            certain circumstances - for example, where the adverse
            impact of macroeconomic disruption is likely to be severe
            but reversible within the existing policy framework; and 2)
            The Government and its partners should consider whether the
            macroeconomic effects of a future such emergency could be
            better provided for, either by targeting a larger build up
            of foreign exchange reserves, or by the development of
            better insurance instruments, like call options.
